STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 23, 2024
Jason Lheureux
KENTWOOD CAMPUS
3290 36TH ST,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49512-8193
Re: License #: CI410201226
SI #: 2024SIC0001584
Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001584
Special Investigation Intake Date: July 15, 2024
License #: CI410201226
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason Lheureux
Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3290 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2025
Capacity: 36
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
7/16/2024 12:28 PM Phone Agency Response Strategy; Special
Investigation Initiation
7/16/2024 3:04 PM Phone Other

7/24/2024 9:18 AM Email Incident Notification
7/24/2024 9:21 AM Email Incident Notification

or sent; Interview

9/9/2024 9:11 AM Phone Interview
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Title & (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Section supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
Description checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 07/03/2024, Youth A told Youth B that he had a vape in his
bedroom. As a result, Youth B went to Youth A’s bedroom to get
the vape. Youth A opened his bedroom door for Youth B and
requested Youth B to perform oral sex on him when entered the
bedroom. Youth B was afraid that Youth A would hurt him if he did
not give him oral sex, so he gave him oral sex and left the
bedroom afterwards. It is unknown if Youth A made any threats to
Youth B to make him believe Youth A would hurt him if he did not
give him oral sex. It is unknown where staff were located at the
time of the incident.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
7/30/24 in coordination with Law Enforcement (LE).
Complainant reported Youth B asked to talk to her and said
“[Youth A] raped me”. Complainant reported Youth B said on
7/3/24, Staff 1 opened the bathroom door for him in the bedroom
hallway, but instead of going fully into the bathroom, Youth B went
into Youth A’s room as soon as Staff 1 was out of sight. Youth B
told Complainant he went into Youth A’s room because Youth A
promised to give him a vape. However, when Youth B entered
Youth A’s room, Youth A told Youth B he didn’t have a vape, and
instructed Youth B to perform oral sex. Youth B told Complainant
he didn’t want to, but he was afraid Youth A would hurt him, so he
did it. Youth B told Complainant Youth A didn’t make any direct
threats against him, but he was scared and felt he had to comply.
Youth B told Complainant after it happened, he asked staff to let
him in his own room, which they did. Complainant reported Youth
B was very open and was crying when he told her what happened.
Complainant reported Youth B never mentioned Youth A
penetrated him during the encounter and he never mentioned how
long he was in the room.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/30/24
in coordination with LE. Youth A reported Youth B has never
been in Youth A’s bedroom or been invited to his bedroom. Youth
A reported before these allegations occurred, Youth A got along
2

well with Youth B and was even trying to mentor Youth B because
Youth B was newer to the unit. Youth A reported Youth B has
asked Youth A for a vape because he’s had some on the unit in
the past, but Youth A told Youth B he didn’t have one. Youth A
reported he has never done anything sexual with Youth B and has
never been in a bedroom alone with him. Youth A reported staff
conduct bed checks regularly and he never has any concerns with
staff not completing bed checks.
Youth B was interviewed face to face by Forensic Interviewer
(FI) at the Child Advocacy Center (CAC) on 7/24/24, and the
interview was observed by this Consultant and LE. Youth B
reported Youth A told him he had a vape in his room. Youth B
wanted to use the vape, so he snuck in Youth A’s room. Youth A
then told Youth B he didn’t have a vape. Youth A pulled down his
pants and told Youth B to get on his knees and “give him head”.
Youth B reported his adrenaline and anxiety was “rushing” so he
listened to Youth A. Youth B reported Youth A’s penis was in his
mouth, and it made him gag almost to the point of throwing up.
Youth A reported he pushed Youth B away and then Youth A had
Youth B bend over the bed. Youth A attempted to pull down Youth
B’s pants, but Youth B stopped him and pulled down his own
pants. Youth B reported Youth A penetrated Youth B anally. Youth
B reported he asked Youth A repeatedly to stop, and eventually
he did. Youth B reported he pulled up his pants, left Youth A’s
room, and asked Staff 1 to open his bedroom. Youth B reported
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were working on 7/3/24, but he did not tell them
what happened. Youth B reported he told Complainant and
Education Specialist about the incident approximately a week after
it occurred. Youth B reported nothing like this has ever happened
with Youth A or any other youth previously or since.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 9/9/24 in coordination
with LE. Staff 1 reported she worked on 7/3/24 but was not aware
of the alleged encounter between Youth A and Youth B until
recently because of this investigation. Staff 1 reported she
remembers one time on 7/3/24, she looked down the hallway and
saw Youth B standing outside of his bedroom door. She stated
through the glass of the hallway door, she motioned her hands to
him like “what are you doing?”, and he responded by shrugging
his shoulders. Staff 1 reported she went into the hallway and
asked Youth B what he was doing and why he wasn’t in his
bedroom. Youth B told Staff 1 he didn’t know. Staff 1 reported she
started to open Youth B’s bedroom door for him, and he said, “but
I was bored”. Staff 1 told him it wasn’t an excuse to be out of his
room, and she let him back into his room and shut the door. Staff
3

1 reported she walked back down the hall and into the milieu. Staff
1 reported she didn’t remember letting Youth B into the bedroom
hallway bathroom that night. Staff 1 reported she did not complete
bed checks that night, but since she was the shift supervisor, she
was responsible for assigning staff to complete them. Staff 1
reported she is supposed to supervise to ensure staff are
completing bed checks appropriately and timely. Staff 1 reported
she’s not sure why checks were documented on the log, but not
completed according to video reviewed. Staff 1 reported she
doesn’t remember bed checks not being done that night.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the CAC on 7/24/24 and
face to face at the facility on 7/30/24 in coordination with LE.
Staff 2 reported on 7/3/24, Youth B came out of his bedroom and
out of the bedroom hallway repeatedly. Staff 2 reported he kept
opening and shutting his door, but he always had a reason for
coming out of his room (i.e. wanting a glass of water, needing to
use the bathroom, etc.). Staff 2 reported he completed bedroom
checks during the timeframe of Youth B going in and out of his
room, and there was no indication that night of anything
happening between Youth A and Youth B or Youth B being in
Youth A’s room. Staff 2 reported since the incident, Youth B has
not tried to avoid Youth A, tries to be around him frequently, and
staff must continue to keep them separated.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 9/5/24 in coordination
with LE. Staff 3 reported he worked on 7/3/24 but was not on the
unit when the suspected encounter between Youth A and Youth B
occurred. Staff 3 reported he went to the skating rink on 7/3/24
with some other youth and was delayed in returning to the facility
due to a small traffic accident. Staff 3 reported he didn’t remember
what time he returned to the unit and doesn’t know what time the
encounter between Youth A and Youth B occurred.
Education Specialist (ES) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 7/30/24 in coordination with LE. ES reported around
7/15/24, Youth B was talking to her, and brought up the incident
with Youth A. ES reported Youth B said “[Youth A] punctured me”.
ES reported she asked a few questions to clarify what Youth B
meant, and he responded almost like he was trying to figure out
how to put the whole story together. Youth B told ES he went into
Youth A’s room to get a vape, but when he got into Youth A’s
bedroom, Youth A said he didn’t have a vape and asked for oral
sex instead. Youth B told ES if he didn’t do it, Youth A said he
would beat him up, so Youth A did it. Youth B told ES after the
oral sex, Youth A told Youth B to bed over the bed, so he did, and
4

then Youth A “punctured” Youth B anally. Youth B told ES he was
in Youth A’s bedroom for approximately 15-20 minutes.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage from 7/3/24 between 8:00-8:45 pm was reviewed.
At 8:09 pm, Youth B entered Youth A’s room or the doorway to
Youth A’s room for about 30 seconds before going back to his
own room. At 8:21 pm, Youth A retrieved Staff 1 from the milieu
and Staff 1 let Youth A into the bathroom in the bedroom hallway.
At 8:22 pm (while Youth A was still in the bathroom), Youth B went
into Youth A’s bedroom or by his bedroom door. Youth A exits the
bathroom right after Youth B arrives near Youth A’s bedroom. At
8:25 pm, Youth B exits Youth A's room and goes to the milieu. At
8:26 pm, Youth B comes back into the hallway at 8:26 pm and
goes back to Youth A’s room. At 8:33 pm, Youth B exits Youth A’s
room with headphones around his neck, and heads towards the
milieu. Youth A peaks his head into the hallway and says
something to Youth B. Youth B walks back, stands outside of
Youth A’s bedroom, and gives Youth A the headphones and goes
back to the milieu. At 8:34 pm, Staff 1 lets Youth B back into his
room. No staff completed bed checks during the timeframe of the
video reviewed.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
• Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County Forensic
Interview Summary (date of interview: 7/24/24), completed
by Forensic Interviewer is consistent with Youth B’s
interview.
• Homeward Bound Therapeutic Services Sexual Risk
Assessment for Youth A dated 6/30/24, completed by
Therapist. Report conclusion notes Youth B does not
present as a sexual risk to children but does present as a
risk to engage in very negative, sexually preoccupied
actions that are presently being seen and likely to lead to
ongoing promiscuous sexual behavior in the community
once released from the facility. Sexual interest in children
or violence are not suspected.
• Reviewed room layout diagram, which shows Youth A and
Youth B’s separate bedrooms were adjacent prior to this
incident occurring. Youth B has since been moved to the
opposite bedroom hallway as a part of the Agency
Response Strategy.
5

• Incident Report dated 7/12/24 completed by Complainant
was consistent with Complainant’s interview.
• Incident Report dated 7/16/24 completed by ES is a much
shorter version but is consistent with ES’s interview.
• Bed Check Procedures (eff. 7/3/24) states bed checks are
to be done on all youth, at variable intervals not to exceed
15 minutes, will begin when the first youth goes to bed, and
staff must physically view the youth’s ‘body or breath’ to
confirm they are safe. Bed checks are to be documented
on the bed check form indicating the time check occurred,
behavioral descriptions of any youth out of bed or not
quietly resting, and staff should initial the form.
• Bed Check forms from 7/3/24 were reviewed. Staff 2
documented he completed bed checks at 8:00 pm, 8:10
pm, 8:16 pm, 8:25 pm, and 8:31 pm. However, according to
video reviewed, these did not occur.
• Staff 1 has 2 disciplinary records in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 was trained in Shift
Supervisors Updates, Trainings & Responsibilities on
2/21/24. Staff 1 signed off on her updated job description
on 1/31/24, which includes a requirement to supervise, as
well as maintain safety and security for youth in the
program.
• Staff 2 has 14 disciplinary records in his employee file. One
of those records is related to this investigation and resulted
in Staff 2’s termination from employment on 8/27/24. Staff 2
was trained on program policies on 8/24/23. Staff 2 signed
off on his updated job description on 1/31/24, which
includes a requirement to supervise, as well as maintain
safety and security for youth in the program.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per video reviewed,
Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not complete bed checks as required.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

Rule Code ACT 116 - 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination
Title & of conditions, books, records, and reports; access by
Section department, bureau of fire services, or local authorities;
Description records; reports report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
information; availability of confidential records; child
information cards to be provided to department; failure of
licensee to cooperation with investigation, inspection, or
examination.
(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine
conditions of a childcare organization and may investigate
and examine the books and records of the licensee. The
licensee shall cooperate with the department’s
investigation, inspection, and examination by doing all of
the following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the
department, and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and
household members, to provide accurate and truthful
information to the department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Bed checks were documented, but not completed.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 9/9/24 in coordination
with LE. Staff 1 reported she did not complete bed checks that
night, but since she was the shift supervisor, she was responsible
for assigning staff to complete them. Staff 1 reported she is
supposed to supervise to ensure staff are completing bed checks
appropriately and timely. Staff 1 reported she’s not sure why
checks were documented on the log, but not completed according
to video reviewed. Staff 1 reported she doesn’t remember bed
checks not being done that night.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the CAC on 7/24/24 and
face to face at the facility on 7/30/24 in coordination with LE.
Staff 2 reported he completed bedroom checks during the
timeframe of Youth B going in and out of his room on 7/3/24, and
there was no indication that night of anything happening between
Youth A and Youth B or Youth B being in Youth A’s room.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage from 7/3/24 between 8:00-8:45 pm was reviewed.
No staff completed bed checks during the timeframe of the video
reviewed.
7

DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
• Bed Check Procedures states bed checks are to be
documented on the bed check form indicating the time
check occurred, behavioral descriptions of any youth out of
bed or not quietly resting, and staff should initial the form.
• Bed Check forms from 7/3/24 were reviewed. Staff 2
documented he completed bed checks at 8:00 pm, 8:10
pm, 8:16 pm, 8:25 pm, and 8:31 pm.
• Employee Handbook “Accuracy of Records” states staff are
expected to provide only information that is accurate,
complete, and do so in a manner that is free from any
misrepresentation.
• Staff 2 has 14 disciplinary records in his employee file. One
of those records is related to this investigation and resulted
in Staff 2’s termination from employment on 8/27/24. Staff 2
signed an acknowledgment of receipt of the employee
handbook on 12/5/23.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as Staff 2 documented he
completed bed checks, but video footage determined the
documented bed checks did not occur.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
September 20, 2024
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 23, 2024
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
8
